replies.body:
Phreak is literally never right when it comes to theorycrafting.  I still remember last season when he tried to talk about runes and it was the biggest noob trap dumpster fire I've ever seen on the front page of reddit.  This is what's wrong with the game.  

1) The total lack of MR early game is disgusting and has completely removed the little counterplay there was vs early poke AND burst mid (contrary to meddler's beliefs, the strongest mid lane champions are incredibly consistent with their ability to stat check you with abilities) and has completely warped the trading patterns bot in practically all match ups and top vs tanks (as in, you can't trade with them at all).  

2) Tanks are the sole class to have taken the opposite extreme and now take almost no damage early game because of their insane armor, especially with stupid as fuck bullshit like aftershock, but because of the total lack of MR, they completely destroy everyone else on their own on top of this

3) Finishing duskblade means you can kill any squishy by just touching them and it's sadly not even hyperbole.  This problem is compounded by the fact that they took the unhealthiest route they possibly could've with TLD.  Instead of giving you a bit of bonus damage per trade, it now gives you an entire abilities worth of damage per rotation (this scales to a bonus ults worth of damage later on) with the incredibly naive and quite frankly lazy notion that it will balance itself out because there should be a difference between the 2.  That's the thing Riot games, in practice there's almost no difference between the 2 and it's mind boggling you don't know this about your own game.  Almost everyone who could proc TLD before can proc electrocute now doing the exact same thing, except now you take literally 5 times the damage.  The added ~20 second cooldown turns out to be meaningless because the 2 biggest users of electrocute, assassins and junglers, are always looking to make every trade lethal.  

4) Sudden impact gives 10 lethality and an especially egregious 8 mpen when no even has the option to start armor and mr.  Honestly wtf were they thinking with half of the new masteries that just give bonus damage for doing nothing.  Garbage like sudden impact doesn't promote new styles of gameplay Riot.  It just gives Katarina 25% more damage when she inevitably rolls her face at you at 2.  This.  Is.  Not.  Healthy.  For.  The.  Fucking.  Game.  You don't all of a sudden just give champions that have been balanced for 7 fucking seasons around certain damage values double the damage just cause.  That's fucking stupid and it's precisely what you got wrong with the first iteration of keystones and you've learned absolutely nothing with these new masteries.  Why do you even need to be told this.  

I'm not going to do the math for Riot, they don't even need to do it themselves.  Just fucking open your client and start a game of league.  I honestly don't know how you can even pretend the games in a healthy state if you play more than 1 game a month.  Even in the last season, where masteries (cause they're not runes, they're masteries) gave a third of the damage, the lowest MR almost anyone started was 34 (because you'd run 6 CDR blues mid).  You don't even have that now.  Everyone starts with 30.  If you played mid even once in your league life you know exactly what happens when you start with 30 MR.  You get touched?  You lose 50% of your HP.  But now everyone starts 30 MR, oh and masteries give three times as much damage as they've ever done before.

This is literally the smartest post I have seen on LoL official forums

Yeah I don't know why people downvoted you. Phreak has consistently shown to not know a THING when it comes to Theory Crafting. Sometimes I wonder who the hell thinks he knows what he is talking about??
I'm gonna go out on a limb here and say nobody at Riot's gonna talk about **physical ranged** damage creep.

He's technically right, and a lot of the 'damage is crazy / snowball meta' stuff is bullshit, in my opinion. 
However... Here's a few counterpoints to his video:

1.) He never really addresses the new damage from Sorcery and Domination Trees, which is absolutely ABSURD. Aery, Comet, Predator, Scorch, Eyeball Collector, ect ect. All of these things can be nuts for early game damage. And they all SCALE better than anything league has ever seen. Not that I think it's a bad thing, I actually think late game scaling is relatively healthy currently. But still,** you can't begin to address how damage feels right now without talking about these items.**

2.) I feel like it's early game that's problematic, where players simply don't have good, easy access to MR out of the gate. The players who get that early advantage turn it into a midgame advantage, and so on and so forth. That's why players **FEEL** like the game is more snowbally.

I also think that most of the burst and snowball complaints are geared towards champs like Maokai or supports who do magic damage but don't BUILD magic damage.  They aren't complaining about a Malzahar E doing half their HP, they are complaining because Sona clocked them for 1/3 of their health in one combo or Maokai came up and did 1/4 their HP in one Q.  So without taking even looking at keystones, those champs ARE doing more damage in most cases, BEFORE KEYSTONES! So add Aeri and or Aftershock or Grasp onto that.

The other thing which Phreak did say is that the Keystone has to do a lot of the heavy lifting. And it is.  I mean if your Malz goes Sorcery primary, then he takes Scorch, which is already doing as much as Deathfire used to, then you add Arcane Comet or Aeri on top of that!?  Then if he goes for free boots in Inspiration he gets to his damage 300g earlier?

Then the third element is that Lethality builders are taking over games I play in.  So I need to see a video on lethality damage builders' damage compared to last season.  My hunch is they are doing more now.

Final element is the removal of catch up xp from kills.  This is fairly straight forward.  Back in the day if you were behind in levels and you managed to kill someone on the enemy team who was like highest or second highest in the game, it would often give you a massive boost to xp resulting in an instant or very expedient level up.  So the leads just stick more now.  This is more of the snowball than the damage argument, but it could contribute to "feeling" like the guy that is ahead is dealing more damage.

Based on what I'm seeing in this video, basic calculations off Runes, and looking at the "extras", here's what I conclude:

Mages, auto attacking ADC's, and AD bruisers/juggers MAY be doing roughly the same damage as before, but EVERYONE ELSE is doing noticeably more damage (Possibly auto attackers and Mages are even doing a touch more damage because of keystones).  For the majority of the game anyway, with outliers being things like lvl 1 trades and Gathering storm in a 50 minute game.  But the kicker is that the runes provide snowball windows everywhere even if base damages are not higher.  Clepto gives money and possible temporary stat buffs, Domination is riddled with situational damage buffs, Gathering storm, randomly getting to cast a spell with mana refunded, getting 10% cdr for free, reduced ult cooldowns, free boots and stopwatch from your SECONDARY path.   I could go on, but I just want to end by saying the keystones and everything you get further down the tree and your secondary tree is a bit much in terms of value.  

In my humble mid-platinum opinion, lets get rid of Keystones all together.  Then separate all the remaining runes into two categories DAMAGE and UTILITY/DEFENSE.  You get to choose three in each.  Enjoy.

It's less in-game defense being an issue rather than more damage, which is evident when you're trying to play a champion that depends on defensive itemization, but has little to no %based defensive scaling/reduction in their kit, like most bruisers not named Garen or Gragas. Also, as was mentioned, early resistances are extremely low, which significantly increases the chances of getting snowballed on by bursty champions that thrive on early leads. The main counter to this as a bruiser is to stack resistances and HP early on, while saving the damage items for later (especially since most bruiser items are crazy expensive atm). I expect bruiser players will start rushing Sunfire into Spirit Visage more often in the near future.

The problem is that most bruiser players (or at least most complainers) do not want to rush a defense item to deny their spike. 

Too many times have I seen people try to rush triforce in a lane they are losing hard.
Because if they go defensive they give up the lane entirely and lose it. Going damage gives them a chance to do something.

Honestly this is why I think fighters and top lane in general need a complete overhaul. For a literal 1v1 lane that isn’t meant to roam as often as mid, Being so easy to fall behind in and thus getting stuck with a laning phase of standing close enough for exp while your ahead enemy freezes lane doesn’t sound fun.
